bibl.title: Samuel O'Brien v. Nancy O'Brien. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Territory of Washington

body.p: Territory of Washington }S.S. County of Spokane

In the District Court of the Territory of Washington, and for the Fourth Judicial District thereof, holding terms at Spokane Falls in said County + Territory. In the matter of the application of Samuel OBrien for a writ of Habeas Corpus for Harry OBrien.

Now at this time this cause coming on to be heard, and the Sheriff of Spokane County being present and having in his custody the body of said Harry OBrien in accordance with the Commands of the writ herein, and the Plaintiff being present represented by Turner + Forster as his attorneys. And the said Nancy OBrien, being represented by A.K. McBrown as her attorney, and the Court being fully advised in the premises, it is ordered and adjudged that the care control and custody of said Harry OBrien be transfered from said Nancy OBrien to said Samuel OBrien as prayed for in the complaint herein.
Dated the 12th day of July 1887 George Turner Judge
In the Distric Court 4th Judicial District Spokane County
In the application Habeas Corpus --for-- Harry OBrien
